text: Harold Rubin (13 May 1932 - 1 April 2020) was a South African-born Israeli visual artist and free jazz clarinettist. He was born in Johannesburg. He became a founding member of the 1980s Zaviot jazz quartet, which recorded albums with the label Jazzis Records and performed at festivals and clubs in Israel and Europe until its break-up in 1989. Rubin died on 1 April 2020, aged 87. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:White South African people Category:Israeli musicians Category:Jazz musicians Category:South African activists
title: Harold Rubin
